issue.title: Joint visualization broken when model rotated

content.raw: I spent a little time looking at this, and it seems that two joint visuals get created for each joint. For models that are loaded with the world file, the code `this->jointMsgs.push_back(msg);` is called by [Scene::ProcessModelMsg, line 1351](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/091e2f1c9179c7f42f388f7ae2e7d8df004973b3/gazebo/rendering/Scene.cc#cl-1351) and [Scene::ProcessSceneMsg line 1279](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/091e2f1c9179c7f42f388f7ae2e7d8df004973b3/gazebo/rendering/Scene.cc#cl-1279). For inserted models, that same code is called by Scene::ProcessModelMsg and [Scene::OnJointMsg line 1607](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/091e2f1c9179c7f42f388f7ae2e7d8df004973b3/gazebo/rendering/Scene.cc#cl-1607).
content.html: I spent a little time looking at this, and it seems that two joint visuals get created for each joint. For models that are loaded with the world file, the code this->jointMsgs.push_back(msg); is called by Scene::ProcessModelMsg, line 1351 and Scene::ProcessSceneMsg line 1279. For inserted models, that same code is called by Scene::ProcessModelMsg and Scene::OnJointMsg line 1607.
